search_term: Find the official pricing page URL for Guru (guru.com). Only provide the exact URL to the pricing page, not a summary of pricing information.
response_text: The official pricing page for Guru can be found at: [https://www.guru.com/membership/freelancer-memberships](https://www.guru.com/membership/freelancer-memberships)【3:0†source】.

citations.title: Guru Pricing for Freelancers - The Benefits of Paid Membership

extracted_content.content:

Pricing & Membership Plans for Freelancers
==========================================

Unlock opportunities. Increase your chances of getting hired for the best freelance jobs by upgrading your membership.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[Employers](https://www.guru.com/pricing-employer/) [Freelancers](https://www.guru.com/pricing-freelancer/)

Benefits of Paid Membership
---------------------------

Unlock additional features that will help you attract more Employers and make more money on the platform.

*   ### Send Premium Quotes
    
    Make your Quote stand out when you bid for work online.
    
*   ### Get More Bids
    
    Receive up to 600 Bids, with an annual rollover of 300 Bids (maximum).
    
*   ### Boost Your Ranking
    
    Make sure Employers see your profile first with search boost.
    
*   ### Pay a Lower Job Fee
    
    Depending on your Agreement and membership level, the Employer can contribute up to 5% towards your job fee.
    
*   ### Send Direct Messages
    
    Only paying members have the option to send direct messages to potential Employers.
    

Membership Plans
----------------

|

\*Save up to 27% when you pay annually

| 

#### **Job Fee**

We charge a nominal fee for our services on every paid invoice.

 | **9%** | **9%** | **7%** | **6%** | **5%** |

#### **Find Jobs**

| 

#### **Number of Bids per year**

Bids are like currency on Guru. You use Bids to send Quotes to Employers. Use 1 Bid to send a Quote.

 | **120** | **600** | **600** | **600** | **600** |
| 

#### **Number of Bids per month**

Bids are like currency on Guru. You use Bids to send Quotes to Employers. Use 1 Bid to send a Quote.

 | **10** | **50** | **50** | **50** | **50** |
| 

#### **Job Q&A**

Ask questions about the job directly from the Employer.

 |   |  |  |  |  |
| 

#### **Annual Bid Rollover**

Any remaining Bids at the end of a year will be added to next year's Bid count.

 |   |   | **100** | **200** | **300** |
| 

#### **Premium Quotes**

Guru Tip:

*   If you are just starting out as a Freelancer, you can choose either Basic or Basic+ Membership. However, if you plan to find freelance work online regularly or manage a team of Freelancers as a business, you should opt for a Professional, Business, or Executive Membership depending on the scale of your operations.

**Note:** Membership purchases are non-transferable and non-refundable. You can renew your membership two weeks before it is set to expire. If your membership expires, you will be downgraded to a Basic Membership. You will be notified at the start of the week and the day before this happens.

Copyright © 2025, Guru.com

 

Privacy Preference Center
-------------------------

Guru.com uses cookies to provide necessary website functionality, improve user experience, and analyze traffic. By using Guru.com, you agree to the[Privacy Policy](https://www.guru.com/privacy-policy/) which includes a Cookies Policy.

Cookies Settings Reject All Accept All Cookies

Privacy Preference Center
-------------------------

When you visit any website, it may store or retrieve information on your browser, mostly in the form of cookies. This information might be about you, your preferences or your device and is mostly used to make the site work as you expect it to. The information does not usually directly identify you, but it can give you a more personalized web experience. Because we respect your right to privacy, you can choose not to allow some types of cookies. Click on the different category headings to find out more and change our default settings. However, blocking some types of cookies may impact your experience of the site and the services we are able to offer.  
[Cookie Notice](https://cookiepedia.co.uk/giving-consent-to-cookies)

Allow All

### Manage Consent Preferences

#### Strictly Necessary Cookies

Always Active

These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off in our systems. They are usually only set in response to actions made by you which amount to a request for services, such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in or filling in forms. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but some parts of the site will not then work. These cookies do not store any personally identifiable information.

#### Performance Cookies

 Performance Cookies

These cookies allow us to count visits and traffic sources so we can measure and improve the performance of our site. They help us to know which pages are the most and least popular and see how visitors move around the site. All information these cookies collect is aggregated and therefore anonymous. If you do not allow these cookies we will not know when you have visited our site, and will not be able to monitor its performance.

#### Functional Cookies

 Functional Cookies

These cookies enable the website to provide enhanced functionality and personalisation. They may be set by us or by third party providers whose services we have added to our pages. If you do not allow these cookies then some or all of these services may not function properly.

#### Targeting Cookies

 Targeting Cookies

These cookies may be set through our site by our advertising partners. They may be used by those companies to build a profile of your interests and show you relevant adverts on other sites. They do not store directly personal information, but are based on uniquely identifying your browser and internet device. If you do not allow these cookies, you will experience less targeted advertising.

### Performance Cookies
